column4: guys, can you tell me why my installation of ubuntu using an alternate CD to my presario is pausing on random stages of the installation and never reached the end where I could use it? this happens everytime and I almost wanna give up. I had to reboot and reinstall about 10 times and still the same thing.... it wont just install fully. It's like asif my dvd drive fell asleep for a moment and sometimes it don't even wake up
erm anyone know how to solve my solution?
: are you sure your cd is good?
yes... verified with the burner software and the "check cd for defect" that is bundeled along with the cd
: hmmm......i really dont know, you say that it stops randomly?
yes at different stages every time. and a side note... the installer recognizes the hard disk im installing is as SCSI1 but i'm sure that it should recognize as IDE or something like that
: Have you tried a regular live CD?
yes and it doesnt even start the graphical stuff. it worked great on the laptop I'm using which i installed ubuntu USING THAT LIVE CD
Z_o-s-1:that's y i turned to alternate cd
: I dont really know what to say here
Z_o-s-1:hmms... thanks for looking into the matter though
just wanna know if it's linked..... does 40pin IDE cables makes data transfer a little difficult?
: It shouldnt matter, did it have windows on it before?
yeah but this is a reformatted hard drive.
I'm trying to have a fresh install in my system
presario : I dont know what could be causing it to freeze
do you think it's because of my 40pin plug? it's connected to a slave and master optical storage drives...
but i had no problems using it in windows before
: Have you tried running memetst86 included on the alt.cd?
erm... is that a RAM test?

k found out that it is... but im sure i have no problems with my ram as i am now switching between 2 hard drives as im currently only on a cable that can only connect 1 hard drive.... going to buy the one with 2 connectors soon for dual boot
